thread.title: China’s Tariffs Are Pinching Chinese Companies, Too

author: Wayne Ma
title: China’s Tariffs Are Pinching Chinese Companies, Too
text:
HONG KONG—The company that makes Smithfield bacon and Nathan’s Famous hot dogs has fallen on the wrong side of China’s new tariffs—despite being Chinese-owned.
China’s largest pork producer, WH Group Ltd., has had sizable operations in the U.S. since acquiring Smithfield Foods Inc. in 2013, and it exports some raw pork back to its home market for processing into packaged products.
